div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

p.em: In a safe and caring environment, Early County School System will provide engaging and challenging educational opportunities to equip students for success.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OwsYgb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.a: Please submit your questions regarding school closure here!

div.p: To All ECSS Family, Friends, and Community:

As you may already know, Governor Kemp has issued an executive order that mandates the closure of all public schools through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year in an attempt to prevent further spread of the Coronavirus. Our hearts are broken for all of our students and teachers and especially for our seniors of 2020. We know that many special events such as prom, spring sports, and a traditional graduation have been taken away from them. However, we will strive to create special events for seniors and for all of our students when it becomes safe to do so.

This also means that my leadership team and I have hard decisions to make and many details to work through. We have met and are working through the details to ensure that our students are given work and grades that reflect a continued desire for challenging instruction but compassion knowing that not all students have equal access to resources or instruction.

Based on guidance from the Georgia Department of Education, along with input from school and district leaders, guidelines are stated below to frame the learning process for the remainder of the year. It is our intention, to the best of our ability, to provide a meaningful educational experience for ALL of our students, including students with disabilities and those with limited internet access.

DIGITAL LEARNING will continue starting after Spring Break (April 6-10) through May 1, 2020, for all students. Digital Learning will be expected Monday through Thursday with Friday as a Fun Friday with a focus on social-emotional learning, and we encourage students to use Fridays to continue physical education and enjoy the beautiful outdoors. We are working to allow access to 7 Mindsets lessons, and Director of Student Services Mrs. Lorie Clenney and the school counselors are available for virtual sessions if students need to make contact. Students are encouraged to set up a schedule and, if possible, a workstation in a dining room, kitchen, or family room to get their work completed. Teachers will provide essential, remedial, and enrichment instruction each day from 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM. Parents, teachers, and students are encouraged to follow this schedule to alleviate stress during this difficult time. Teachers will strive to send communications no later than 4:00 PM each day. Based on each grade level’s or course’s standards and requirements as determined by teachers and administrators, teachers will focus on essential standards and will provide remediation where needed. Students who are gifted will be encouraged to participate in enrichment opportunities. Please let a teacher or principal know if a student needs support, which may be instructional or if there is a resource need. We will work to make sure each student’s needs are met to the best of our ability.

After May 1, teachers will focus on students who need assistance in completing work either because they have not had access or because they have not understood the assignments. GRADES will be based on a philosophy of HELP NOT HURT. For example, if a student had a C prior to the shutdown, he/she will have the opportunity to raise that grade to B or A, but the grade will not be lowered. Students will complete assignments in order to receive credit for classes. PROMOTION/RETENTION will work as it did in the past. Principals and Teachers will determine eligibility.

As we continue to monitor and navigate these very turbulent waters, know how very proud I am to be a Bobcat. As is Early County’s tradition, we are stepping up to help out and to provide support for each other during this difficult time. As we are learning about more positive Coronavirus tests and that members of our staff, student body, and community have been tested and are awaiting results, we continue to band together and stand ready to help in any way possible. Be assured that even though most of our team members are not in the normal classrooms and offices, we are here – in our homes at our work stations doing the very best we can for our precious students.

In an abundance of caution and with the safety and wellness of all students, families, and staff in mind, the Early County School System continues the suspension of meal distribution. However, we have applied for an option that will allow for home deliveries. It is our hope and prayer that this will be a great service for as many families as possible, and we are working on how to provide access to that service. We will let everyone know the steps for signing up and will keep the community posted on the timeline and details.

Mrs. Tammy Storey is creating a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document that will go on our website and on our Facebook pages that will allow for all of the commonly asked questions and current answers to be listed. I encourage you to check that resource before reaching out to administrators as the question you have may already have been answered.

Staff are asked to stay out of the buildings and stay home for their protection and the protection of their families and the community. I encourage you to please continue to limit your social activities, practice social distancing, wash your hands, and protect the elderly as well as people with chronic health conditions in the days and weeks ahead. If I may be of service, please do not hesitate to contact me.
